original: LJUNGGREN, Carl-Fredrik, Direktör, Malmö, f Konga, Malmöh l, 7/8 92 av lantbr J L o Elna Persson, gm Clary Åkerman. Mariannelunds prakt sk 14—15, Hvilans h avd 15—16, Alnarp 16—18, agronomex 18. Insp FHK :s foderbyrå Malmö 18—19, omb.m bondefrbs Skåneorg 20—32, vkst dir Sk Dagbl sed. 32. Styr.led i detta sed. 38, Tidn arb.giv.frn sed. 39, led dess deleg f avt.förhandl sed. 38, v. styr.ordf Sv tidn.utg.frns S krets sed. 37, ordf dess kommissionärsutsk i Malmö sed. bild 33, en av stift av Sk agronomkl 27, dess v. ordf t 40, HdL sed. 40, do SLU Skåne- distr. Studieresa Norge 31. Av trycket: Hur Norges bönder organiserade mjölken. RVO, Sv luftsk.frbs ftjt s.
translated: LJUNGGREN, Carl-Fredrik, Director, Malmö, born in Konga, Malmö County, on July 8, 1892, to farmer J L and Elna Persson, married to Clary Åkerman. Attended Mariannelunds Practical School from 1914 to 1915, Hvilans Agricultural Department from 1915 to 1916, and Alnarp from 1916 to 1918, obtaining a degree in agriculture. Served as an inspector at FHK's Feed Bureau in Malmö from 1918 to 1919, then as a representative for the Skåne Regional Organization of Farmers' Associations from 1920 to 1932, and later became the Deputy Director of the Skånska Dagbladet newspaper in 1932. Became a board member of Skånska Dagbladet in 1938 and a member of the Newspaper Employers' Federation since 1939, also serving as a member of its negotiating delegation since 1938 and vice chairman for the Swedish Newspaper Publishers' Association's Skåne branch since 1937. Elected chairman of its Commissioner's Committee in Malmö since its establishment in 1933. Also a member of the Board of Trustees for the Swedish Agricultural Society since 1927, becoming its vice-chairman in 1940. Became a member of the Swedish Parliament in 1940 and the Swedish National Farmers' Association since 1940. Participated in a study trip to Norway in 1931. Author of the publication "How Norwegian farmers organized their dairy industry." Awarded the Royal Victorian Order and a member of the Swedish Air Force's Flight Association.

structured.name: Carl-Fredrik Ljunggren
structured.description: Carl-Fredrik Ljunggren was a Swedish director born on July 8, 1892, in Konga, Malmö County. He was married to Clary Åkerman. Ljunggren attended Mariannelunds Practical School, Hvilans Agricultural Department, and Alnarp where he studied agriculture. He worked as an inspector at FHK's Feed Bureau in Malmö and later became a representative for the Skåne Regional Organization of Farmers' Associations. In 1932, Ljunggren joined Skånska Dagbladet as the Deputy Director and eventually became a board member. He was also involved in various associations such as the Newspaper Employers' Federation and the Swedish Newspaper Publishers' Association. Ljunggren was an active member of the Swedish Parliament and the Swedish National Farmers' Association. He authored the publication 'How Norwegian farmers organized their dairy industry' and received the Royal Victorian Order. Ljunggren was also a member of the Swedish Air Force's Flight Association.

career.workplace: Skåne Regional Organization of Farmers' Associations
